article:
I stood up and studied the crowd of people making their way through the station. I looked for the girl whose heart I knew, but whose face I    _   , the girl with the    _   . The story had begun twelve months before in a    library   . Taking a book off the shelf I found myself    _    by the notes penciled in the margin  . The soft handwriting  55 _   a thoughtful soul and insightful   mind. In the front of the book, I discovered the    _    owner's name, Rosanna.
During the next year we two grew to know each other through the   _   . Each letter was a seed falling on a fertile heart. The day finally came for our first    _    -7:00 P.M. at the station.
A beautiful young woman was coming towards me, her    _    tall and slim. I started to walk towards her with delight, entirely forgetting to  60 _   that she was not wearing a rose. I  61 _   made one step closer to her, and then I saw Rosanna, a short and fat woman well past 40, was standing almost directly  62 _   the girl. The girl in the green suit was walking quickly away.
I felt  63 as though   I was split   in two, and there she stood. My fingers gripped the worn leather copy of the  64 _   that was to identify me to her. I knew this would not be  65 love  , something perhaps even better than love. I felt choked by the bitterness of my  66 _  . "I'm John, and you must be Rosanna. I am so glad you could meet me; may I take you to  67 dinner  ?"
The woman's face broadened into a big smile. "I don't know what this is about, son," she answered, "but the young lady in the green suit who just  68 went by   begged me to wear this rose on my coat. And she said  69 _   you were to ask me out to dinner, I should go and tell you that she is waiting for you in the big  70 _   across the street. She said it was some kind of test!"
